evs4j
Interface Connection

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConnectionDecorator
public interface Connection

Connection objects are used to join/rejoin a group, to send messages, and to register a Listener object, which can receive messages.

Method Summary
 void close()
          This method closes the connection.
 Message createMessage(boolean safe)
          Returns a Message object to be used for sending.
 int getMaxMessageSize()
          Returns the maximum number of useful bytes contained in a packet (total size minus header).
 Processor getProcessor()
          Returns the Processor object for this processor.
 void open()
          This method opens the connection for sending and receiving.
 void reset()
          This method tells the connection to create a new configuration.
 void send(Message message)
          Enqueues a message for sending.
 void setListener(Listener listener)
          Sets the Listener to which the connection will pass asynchronous events, such as incoming messages and installed configurations.
 

Method Detail

createMessage

Message createMessage(boolean safe)
Returns a Message object to be used for sending. The client must set the data in the byte array. The Message returned has the senderId property already set, but no meaningful message id.

getMaxMessageSize

int getMaxMessageSize()
Returns the maximum number of useful bytes contained in a packet (total size minus header).

getProcessor

Processor getProcessor()
Returns the Processor object for this processor.

open

void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
This method opens the connection for sending and receiving. This method causes this 'processor' to attempt to form a new configuration with other processors on the network. After this the first method that will be called is Listener.onConfiguration(Configuration), and then messages start being delivered. A connection cannot send messages until after open() is called.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

close

void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
This method closes the connection. The Connection's behavior is undefined after it is closed.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

reset

void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
This method tells the connection to create a new configuration. The new configuration is usually needed because the number of messages that can sent in a single configuration is limited by the size of a Java int. Complicated stacks of connection will also find other reasons to force new configurations to be created.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

send

void send(Message message)
          throws java.io.IOException
Enqueues a message for sending.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

setListener

void setListener(Listener listener)
Sets the Listener to which the connection will pass asynchronous events, such as incoming messages and installed configurations. This method must be called before open() or some messages may be missed.
